H0.text: Location and mass of the sample would probably be most helpful to someone trying to identify a mineral sample.

H1.text: Shape and texture of the sample are probably the most helpful information for someone trying to identify a mineral sample.

H2.text: Hardness and streak of the sample are probably the most helpful information to someone trying to identify a mineral sample.

H3.text: Color and size of the sample are probably the most helpful information for someone trying to identify a mineral sample.

A4.text: The Mohs scale is useful for identification of minerals in the field.

A5.text: Hardness may be difficult to determine, or may be misleading or meaningless, if a material is a mixture of multiple substances.

A6.text: Physical properties applied for classification include hardness and streak.

A7.text: Colour is the most obvious property of a mineral, but it is often non-diagnostic.
